intro: Dacryodes kostermansii, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a tropical tree native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its dense, dark-colored wood that is highly valued for its durability and strength. The plant typically grows in humid lowland forests and has compound leaves with small, elliptical leaflets. It produces small, fragrant flowers followed by fleshy, orange-red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife.
